{"step_by_step_thinking": "Circular RNAs are a type of noncoding RNA that, unlike linear RNAs, form a covalently closed continuous loop. They have been found to play crucial roles in various biological processes. Recent studies have shown that circular RNAs are implicated in various diseases, including diseases of the eye such as age-related macular degeneration and diabetic retinopathy.", "answer_choice": "A"}
